content: the tiniest beasties are often the fiddliest to knit but this little squirrel is surprisingly straightforward you knit the squirrel in one piece from tail tip to nose and then wet felt it down to a neat miniature of itself the legs and tail are knitted as simple short row the squirrel is knitted as a length of i-cord to knit i-cord when you have finished working a row push all the stitches to the wrong end of the double pointed needle so that the working yarn is attached to the stitch that is furthest from the working needle tip begin working the next row knitting the first stitch a little more tightly than usual to help pull the two edges of the knitting together into a tube the strands that join the i-cord form a slightly red open ladder though which the squirrel is later stuffed the ladder disappears during wet felting squirrel size 8 2 cm / 3 25 in long gauge 25 sts and 34 row over 10 cm / 4 in in stocking stitch using 2 75mm needles brooch prior to felting the gauge is not critical for this project needles 2 75mm double pointed needles only 2 needed yarn jamieson s of shetland spindrift jumper 4 ply/fingering weight 100% shetland wool 105 m / 115 yds per 25g ball 9 m / 10 yds needed per squirrel shades paprika 261 or burnt umber 1190 both make naturalistic red squirrels or 4 ply / fingering yarn that knits to the specified gauge and is wet feltable i e 100% wool and not superwash treated notions black embroidery thread for sewing nose 40 cm e g 40cm of 2 strands of stranded embroidery tapestry needle cotton brooch pin optional 2 black beads for eyes c 2 2mm diameter 10/0 glass seed beads but 9/0 and 11/0 at sewing needle for between 2 0 and 2 8mm diameter work well tiny beads may need a fine beading needle to fit embroidery through their hole you can replace the beads with embroidered french knots in which case you will need a little more embroidery thread abbreviations st stitch k knit k2tog knit 2 together p purl kfb knit twice into the same stitch- once through the front loop once through the back loop ws wrong side kfbf knit three times into the same st- once through the front of the loop once through the back loop rs right side of the same st and once more through the front loop pattern the legs and ears are worked as simple short row loops cast on 2 st and work all rounds as i-cord with no wrapping round 1 kfb x 2 4 sts back leg round 2 k4 short row 1 rs k2 turn 2 sts round 3 k kfb x 3 7 sts short row 2 ws p2 turn round 4 k to end work short row 1-2 a further 3 times ending with a ws round 5 k2
